Maptime

time for mapmaking

Our mission is to open the doors of cartographic possibility to anyone interested by creating a time and space for collaborative learning, exploration, and map creation using mapping tools and technologies.

CartoCSS Examples

Questions often arise about where to find good CartoCSS examples for using the Open Source map design tool, TileMill. Thanks to Will Skora, there are a couple of resources listed.

  • Mapbox TileMill examples
  • OpenStreetMap Carto
  • OSM Hybrid Carto
  • Toner for TileMill: A port of Stamen’s map style Toner for Tilemill.
  • Simple OSM
  • Transit Map
  • OSM Bright: OSM Bright is a starting point for quickly making street-level maps in TileMill based on an OpenStreetMap database. See also the Quickstart Guide.
  • Quiet LA: LA Times’ ‘Quiet LA’ Map style.
  • Pandonia: Style made by flickr.
  • Geosprocket Carto
  • Dane Springmeyer: Experimental CartoCSS styles from Tilemill and mapnik developer.
  • HOT: A mapping style for humanitarian contexts from HOT, the humanitarian openstreetmap team.
  • OSM Carto: A project to re-implement the standard OpenStreetMap mapnik style, in CartoCSS.
  • Skorasaurus Style: multi-zoom level map of the locations of items for a scavenger hunt in an urban downtown based on OSM Bright.

If you see some that should be here, just fork this repo, edit this post, and make a pull request. Or, just mention MaptimePDX on twitter to get your example listed.

This website is open source and you can improve it. Learn more about contributing here.
